intro: Jaundea congolana, commonly known as the Congo jaundea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
